cxro.common.device.scanner

Interface Scanner

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Device

    public interface Scanner
extends Device
    Interface for Scanner devices.

    This describes a generic interface for scanning devices. These are multichannel devices which enable relative motion about a center position.

    The channels are numbered 1..size, where size is the number of device channels.
    The channel position is represented as a signed 32-bit integer. Where the maximum and minimum values represent the extreme positive and negative displacement of the scanner. REVISION NOTES:
    2016-03-05 : Initial.

    Author:
    Carl Cork <cwcork@lbl.gov>

      • setTargetPosition

        void setTargetPosition(int channel,
                       int position)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Set single point target position.

        This is the scaled target for the position control.

        Positions are signed values. and scaled to a full range of 32-bits (+/- 2147483647). For example, if the full travel range is 100 micrometers and the desired target position is 35 micrometers, then the commanded target position would be 1503238552 = ((4294967294/100) * 35).

        Parameters:
        channel - Channel number for stage [1..size].
        position - Scaled target position
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getTargetPosition

        int getTargetPosition(int channel)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Get the commanded target position.

        This is the scaled target for the position control.

        Positions are signed values and scaled to a full range of 32-bits (+/- 2147483647). For example, if the full travel range is 100 micrometers and the target position is 35 micrometers, then the reported target position would be 1503238552 = ((4294967294/100) * 35).

        Parameters:
        channel - Channel number for stage [1..size].
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getPosition

        long getPosition(int channel)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Get sensor readback position.

        This is the scaled sensor readback position. For most scanners, the zero position is the middle of the travel range.

        Positions are signed values and scaled to a full range of 32-bits (+/- 2147483647). For example, if the full travel range is 100 micrometers, the current raw position is 35 micrometers, then the reported position would be 1503238552 = ((4294967294/100) * 35).

        Note: the sensor can sometimes read beyond the maximum target position. So the value is actually returned as a 64-bit integer, to avoid conversion errors.

        Parameters:
        channel - Channel number for stage [1..size].
        Returns:
        Scaled sensor position.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If some I/O error occurs (details in message).

      • setWaveformDwell

        void setWaveformDwell(int channel,
                      double dwell)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Set waveform step dwell time.

        Dwell = time to wait before the next waveform point is output.

        This feature may not be supported by all scanners. In addition, the granularity of this setting will often depend on the scanner's step processing interval. For instance, for the nPoint LC.400 systems, the dwell time must be increments of 24 microseconds. The actual dwell time can be determined using the getWaveformDwell(channel)

        Parameters:
        channel - Channel number for stage [1..size].
        dwell - Dwell time, in seconds.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If some I/O error occurs (details in message).

      • getWaveformDwell

        double getWaveformDwell(int channel)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Get waveform step dwell time.

        Dwell = time to wait before the next waveform point is output.

        The granularity of this setting will often depend on the scanner's step processing interval. For instance, for the nPoint LC.400 systems, the dwell time is in increments of 24 microseconds. The reported time may not be the same as the time requested using setWaveformDwell(channel, dwell).

        Parameters:
        channel - Channel number for stage [1..size].
        Returns:
        Dwell time, in seconds.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If some I/O error occurs (details in message).

      • setWaveformStart

        void setWaveformStart(int channel)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Start waveform processing on specified channel.

        If the waveform mode is enabled, this initiates waveform processing on a single channel.

        Parameters:
        channel - Channel number for stage [1..size].
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If some I/O error occurs (details in message).

      • setWaveformStart

        void setWaveformStart(int[] channels)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Start simultaneous waveform processing on multiple channels.

        If the waveform mode is enabled for the specified channels, this initiates waveform processing on all of these channels.

        Parameters:
        channels - array containing list of channels for simultaneous processing.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If some I/O error occurs (details in message).

      • setWaveformOffset

        void setWaveformOffset(int channel,
                       int position)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Set static offset position.

        This defines the start/stop position for waveform motion.

        Positions are signed values and scaled to a full range of 32-bits (+/- 2147483647).

        Parameters:
        channel - Channel number for stage [1..size].
        position - scaled offset position, relative to stage center (range 32-bits).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If some I/O error occurs (details in message).

      • setWaveform

        void setWaveform(int channel,
                 int[] points)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Set waveform points.

        During waveform processing, the controller steps through the specified array of positions. The controller will pause for the current dwell time before processing the next position in the array.

        Parameters:
        channel - Channel number for stage [1..size].
        points - array of step positions in waveform.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If some I/O error occurs (details in message).

        Parameters:

        Returns:
